sense.name: make a rhythmic sound
sense.examples: The rain drummed against the windshield. She loves to drum her fingers on the desk. He drummed an intricate rhythm on the bongos.

sense.name: play a drum
sense.examples: He breaks too many sticks when he drums. He drums in bands such as Acoustic Ladyland, Oriole, and Menlo Park. She drummed for the first two tracks of their new CD.

sense.name: teach in an insistent, repetitive way
sense.examples: We had to drum into them the consequences of drunk driving. I tried to drum the verb conjugations into my head. Firefighters rely on training that's drummed into them through repeated exercises.

sense.name: gather, encourage
sense.examples: He goes to the weekly Rotary lunch, where he drums up ad dollars. He is drumming up support for several research projects that his nonprofit foundation will oversee.

sense.name: force from a position or office
sense.examples: He was drummed out of the British army in 1786. They ought to be drummed out the university. They tried to drum him out of office but failed.
